intro: Chamaesyce galapageia, commonly known as Galápagos spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually alternate and oval in shape. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, often found near the shoreline. Chamaesyce galapageia is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of the Galápagos, including strong winds and limited soil nutrients.
